1e50dd52-1c8e-4e41-9d11-4439cf90392e.description: The earner of this credential is able to facilitate discussions focused on exploring, understanding, and resolving conflict around diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. They demonstrate the emotional intelligence and systems thinking required to elicit authentic dialogue, challenge assumptions and generalizations, remain neutral, and make independent determinations of symptoms, root causes, and root solutions.
1e50dd52-1c8e-4e41-9d11-4439cf90392e.name: Certified Diversity and Belonging Facilitator

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Diversity and Belonging Facilitator have completed Diversity and Belonging Culture Facilitation training on the 7 Tenets of Culture Facilitation: 1. Listening to Understand; 2. Challenging Assumptions and Generalizations; 3. Connecting People and Ideas; 4. Remaining Neutral; 5. Eliciting Authentic Trust and Dialogue; 6. Checking In Throughout; and 7. Distinguishing Symptoms from Root Causes. Additionally, the training introduces diversity, equity, and belonging content and scenarios.

Certified Diversity and Belonging Facilitator have passed a comprehensive 2-part exam. Part 1 required the students to facilitate culture discussions in one-on-one and group sessions. The facilitated culture discussions were scored by Certified Master Facilitators based on the students ability to demonstrate the 7 Tenets of Culture Facilitation. Part 2 was a written exam that tested the students understanding and comprehension of the multi-faceted aspects of facilitating culture discussions.

beec66bd-9fa7-4f5b-9087-ba5dc1f7cde2.description: The earner of this credential is able to assess workplace culture in an objective and accurate manner. They demonstrate the emotional intelligence and systems thinking required to review multiple strategic sources (surveys, complaints, demographics, interview inputs, etc.) and make independent determinations of culture health, root causes, and root solutions.
beec66bd-9fa7-4f5b-9087-ba5dc1f7cde2.name: Certified Culture Assessor

badge_template_activities.title: Certified Culture Assessors have completed Culture Facilitation training and Culture Assessment training. The training focused on 5 overarching facets of assessing workplace culture: 1. Distinguishing symptoms from root causes; 2. Performing strategic source reviews; 3. Facilitating Culture Sessions; 4. Understanding and distinguishing different levels of culture health; and 5. Making connections between root causes and root solutions.

Certified Culture Assessors have passed a comprehensive 3-part exam that requires them to: write a formal culture assessment; distinguish symptomatic findings from root causes; and demonstrate a keen awareness of the multi-faceted aspects of assessing workplace culture.
